content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic prostate cancer with rhabdoid differentiation
	   Diagnosed January 2024
	   Stage IV disease with brain metastases and spinal cord compression
	   Treatment aim: Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Emergency T8-T10 decompressive laminectomy

	Radiotherapy
	20 Jan 2024 Emergency whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions
	25 Jan 2024 Post-operative thoracic spine radiotherapy 30Gy in 10 fractions

	Chemotherapy
	1 Feb 2024 Commenced Docetaxel and ADT
	15 Mar 2024 Docetaxel discontinued after 3 cycles due to clinical deterioration

	Clinical studies
	Not suitable

	Current disease status
	Clinically progressive disease with deteriorating neurological function

	Current issues
	1. Progressive neurological deficit
	2. Severe fatigue
	3. Cognitive decline

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with his wife and daughter. Unfortunately, he has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past two weeks. His mobility has worsened with increasing lower limb weakness, now requiring wheelchair for all transfers. He is spending >50% of time in bed (PS 3). New onset confusion and memory problems suggest progression of brain metastases despite previous WBRT.

His PSA has risen from 567 to 890 despite ADT. Recent molecular profiling shows RB1 and TP53 loss, suggesting evolution to treatment-resistant disease. MRI spine shows new epidural disease at C5-C6 despite previous radiotherapy to thoracic spine.

On examination, there is marked reduction in power of both lower limbs (3/5 proximally, 2/5 distally), with new left-sided upper limb weakness (4/5). Cognitive assessment shows significant deterioration with MMSE 18/30 (previously 26/30).

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI brain arranged for tomorrow
	Repeat CT CAP booked for next week if clinically appropriate

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone increased to 8mg BD
	Increased opioid analgesia

	Follow up
	Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	Neurosurgical opinion requested regarding C5-C6 compression

	Required GP actions
	Please arrange urgent community palliative care support
	Consider DS1500

	Summary of information given to patient and family
	Detailed discussion with family regarding disease progression and poor prognosis. Agreement to focus on symptom control and quality of life. DNR status confirmed.

primary_cancer.metastases: brain metastases, spinal cord compression at T8-T10 and C5-C6
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: RB1 and TP53 loss, PSA 890 (rising from 567)

cancer_timeline.value: Emergency whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions
Post-operative thoracic spine radiotherapy 30Gy in 10 fractions
Docetaxel discontinued after 3 cycles due to clinical deterioration
PSA risen from 567 to 890 despite ADT
MRI spine shows new epidural disease at C5-C6

patient_facts.value: PS 3, spending >50% of time in bed
Increasing lower limb weakness requiring wheelchair for transfers
New onset confusion and memory problems
Lower limbs power 3/5 proximally, 2/5 distally, new left-sided upper limb weakness 4/5

status_updates.value: Aggressive metastatic prostate cancer with rhabdoid features showing rapid progression despite initial multimodal treatment. Significant neurological deterioration with new cervical cord compression and progressive brain metastases
Disease progression with rising PSA from 567 to 890 despite ADT
Significant deterioration in mobility and cognition, now PS 3 and wheelchair dependent
Urgent MRI brain tomorrow and CT CAP next week if appropriate
Urgent palliative care review tomorrow and neurosurgical opinion requested
